org.araneaframework.framework.filter
Class StandardMessagingFilterWidget

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.core.BaseComponent
      org.araneaframework.core.BaseService
          org.araneaframework.core.BaseWidget
              org.araneaframework.framework.core.BaseFilterWidget
                  org.araneaframework.framework.filter.StandardMessagingFilterWidget
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, FilterWidget, MessageContext, java.io.Serializable, Service, Widget
public class StandardMessagingFilterWidget
extends BaseFilterWidget
implements MessageContext

Adds a MessageContext implementation to the environment that can be used to add messages for later output.

An example how to add messages to the context follows: 

 
 ...
 MessageContext messageContext = (MessageContext)getEnvironment().get(CallContext.class);
 messageContext.addMessage(MessageContext.INFO_TYPE, "Hello message!");

Author:
"Toomas RÃ¶mer" , Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov at araneaframework dot org)

render

protected void render(OutputData output)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Adds all the messages to the output as Map under the key MessageContext.MESSAGE_KEY. The keys of the Map are the different message types encountered so far and under the keys are the messages in a Collection.

A child service should do as follows to access the messages 

 
 ...
 Map map = output.getAttribute(MESSAGE_KEY);
 Collection list = (Collection)map.get(MessageContext.ERROR_TYPE); // collection contains all the error messages
The map could be null if this service was not used. The collection is null if no messages of that type been added to the messages.

Overrides:
render in class BaseFilterWidget
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
